intro: Pedicularis artiae, commonly known as the golden lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite and often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. Pedicularis artiae is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes.
